required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Femoral Versus Jugular Routes for Temporary Hemodialysis in Seriously Ill Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Complications of Jugular and Femoral Venous Catheterization in Critically Ill Patients Requiring Hemodialysis: A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether a jugular route leads to a lower rate of complications as compared with a femoral route for catheterization in patients admitted in several intensive care units in France who develop acute renal failure requiring hemodiafiltration or hemodialysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rates of infectious complications including cath-colonization
Quality of hemodialysis by urea extraction ratio

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Admitted in intensive care unit (ICU)
- Requiring hemodialysis
- Clinicians have the choice between jugular and femoral routes
Exclusion Criteria:
- Chronic renal failure requiring long term dialysis

facility.name: Medical and nephrologic Intensive Care Unit, CHU Amien Sud
Medical Intensive Care Unit, CHU de Caen

link.description: Literature summary of central venous catheter complications
Guidelines for the prevention of intravascular catheter-related infections
